author: BWhyte
title: Fun set
review: I found this set in my old storage box.  The stickers are worn, but it goes great with my 6375 gas station.  The doors underneath are cool.  The only negative is that it is not minifig sized so the driver cannot "get in" the truck.  He has to hang out at the station.

author: hustla187
title: Exxon the Spot!
review: This is a nice little set with some features like a hose, a truck with no space for minifig and a tanker. I like the minifig holding the hose which is pretty cool. This is an OK set for an old town set.

author: devilhead
title: Happy Motoring indeed!
review: This is a set from a simpler time in Lego history.  Parts were less specialized; figures didn't always fit in their vehicle; a little more imagination was required.  The design is elegant with no excessively complex parts or construction.  The color scheme is tasteful.  The only real drawback is the use of stickers that overlap multiple bricks.
